title: Language Learning Interaction Design Using Virtual Reality Gamification

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Digital Tool Proficiency and Foundational Language Learning Concepts
context.additional_context: Real-time language learning environment combining virtual reality platforms with gamification elements; learners interact via avatars, with outcomes influenced by seating arrangements and interaction type selections

learning_goals: Learners can analyze interaction preference differences based on seating selection in virtual reality spaces with 80% accuracy
Learners can propose at least three interaction strategies with peer learners using gamification elements (quests, rewards)
Learners can empirically demonstrate through experimental data that human interaction is over 20% more effective for knowledge acquisition than object interaction in language learning
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
